inn1.comm: good length ball outside off stump, some swing there, nudged past gully down to third man for one first-thing
pitched on leg and moving down, Gayle falls over trying to defend, swings a lot down leg
this lands on off stump and kicks up, Chanderpaul does well to stand and keep that down with soft hands, well bowled and well played
this stands up as well at a rapid pace, Chanderpaul's caught trying to drive towards mid-off but the ball takes the outer edge and speeds past gully, the fast outfield gets him four, streaky
good, quick ball on the stumps, Chanderpaul defends with a straight bat
too full and he firmly punches that in the gap between Clarke at backward point an Symonds at cover and the ball again speeds away across the quick outfield, good shot
too full and wide outside off stump, wide called, bad start
short and wide, Gayle's bread and butter, he doesnt time the chop/cut that well but this man's caught such power that the ball speeds past point for four
full and swinging away outside off stump, Gayle leaves that alone
full again, some swing on that, Gayle again lets its pass watchfully
full and wider, Gayle watches it and then looks at the umpire, but no reaction that side

good ball! Swings in this time from outside off stump, clips the back thigh as Gayle plays forward and misses, and deviates away, every Australian goes up in appeal but Aleem Dar stands motionless, that was a tremendous shout
full outside off stump, Gayle comes forward and gets beaten
fullish on middle and leg, Chanderpaul drives airily over mid-on, he basically tried to pull out of his shot, luckily for him the ball popped over the fielder
full outside off stump, Chanderpaul tries to drive across the line, ball speeds into Lee who tries to catch it but cant get a hand to it, ball nearly took his head off as it speeds down the ground
short, cut to Ponting at point
wide down the pads but its called a no-ball as he overstepped
good length ball outside off stump, Chanderpaul shuffles across and drives back down the ground, Lee fields moving to his right
full outside off stump, he tries to whip that into the midwicket stands, ball flies off the outside edge and sails over McGrath at third man for maximum, madness!
good length ball angling across him, he shuffles and gets behind it, defends back to Lee's left
good length ball seaming away outside off stump, Gayle covers his stumps and allows it through to Gilchrist
good length ball comes into him, Gayle stands and presents the full face of the bat, ball hurries to mid-off but Gayle calls for the run and gets it
full and wide outside off stump, Chanderpaul thinks about flaying that through the off side but holds off, wide called anyways
not as wide this time, Chanderpaul shoulders arms
this one's full and moving in, Chanderpaul doesnt get to the pitch of it but goes through with the free-flowing drive, ball goes to mid-off
full and wide outside off stump again, Gayle shoulders arms with a big stride forward
a rank half-volley, Gayle just gets a foot forward and bludgeons that past Clarke at mid-off for four, super timing and West Indies are off to a flier
full pitched outside leg stump, Chanderpaul tries the pick-up flick over square leg but misses, Lee appeals but that was clearly going down leg
on a good length on middle and leg, Chanderpaul comes forward and whips that in the gap at midwicket, superb placement and Gayle's not even running, four runs all the way
he tries a slower ball this time, but its on leg stump and Chanderpaul turns that to  the left of midwicket, well played

good ball that comes into him, but thats an incredible shot! Gayle just taps that ball and it bounces wide of Lee and speeds away for four, but it was just a back-foot defensive, insane timing and power from this man
lands outside off stump, again Gayle pushes down the ground but Martyn at mid-off's onto it
too full, easy pickings, bad bowling (its a no-ball!) and Gayle smashes that past Martyn at mid-off, this is carnage, folks
moves around the wicket and lands in on off stump, Gayle stands and defends, a dot ball to end the over, whew
gone! That landed outside off stump and kept low, Chanderpaul stood leaden-footed and went for the cut, but gets an inside edge onto off stump, he's gone and Bracken jumps in celebration
moves across him on a driveable length, Sarwan gets forward and pushes to cover
back of a length on the stumps, Sarwan stands and defends with a 'NO' back to Gayle
a rank full toss outside off stump, the attempted slow ball, and Sarwan drives that through cover for four, lost the hand off the bat but the placement was excellent
full and cutting across him this time, Sarwan shoulders arms
useless ball, pitches well wide of leg stump and swings away, Gilchrist does well to collect
change of pace as he moves one across him, and Sarwan covers off stump and allows it to pass through safely
short and wide outside leg stump, Gayle goes for the hook but misses, wide called
pitches outside leg stump, Gayle goes for a heavy whip over midwicket but misses, gets a leg bye for his efforts
full outside off stump and moving in, he stands and tries to tickle fine, mistimes and gets a quick single in front of square leg
moves around the wicket to the left-hander, lands this bang outside off stump and moves it in, Gayle hurries to get behind and drop the hands
lands on a good length on middle and leg and moves down leg, wide not called by Koertzen
lands outside off and moves away, sucking Gayle into the forward defensive, he's beaten
hoo hah! Overpitched outside off stump, Gayle frees the arms and smacks that across the line, lifts it high and handsome with sheer brute force over long-on, incredible shot from the big man
lands on leg stump and its tickled around the corner for a hard-run double, Lee moves across and does the fielding down there
good ball on the stumps, Sarwan tries to run that down but mistimes it, comes onto it early and the ball rolls to point

gone! Change of pace, lands it on middle and leg and all Sarwan can do is turn that off the outer edge of the bat for the dolliest of catches to mid-on, a tame dismissal, as he closed the face of the bat on the attempted whip, and Bracken has another
good ball to get, moves across him from off stump and he lets it pass
slower ball, attempted yorker on off stump, he drops the hands and keeps it out
good ball on the stumps, Bravo comes forward and defends, another successful over from Bracken
shortish outside off stump, Gayle moves back and crunches that to mid-on
banged in short again, and this time Gayle rocks into the pull shot in a flash, picking that up from outside off stump for a dinger over deep midwicket, was a perfect ball to pull
again he drops one short from around the wicket, and Gayle smashes the pull past mid-on this time, ball screams away for four, terrific batting
this is brutal! A rank halfvolley outside off stump disappears in a flash past a despairing Martyn at mid-off, what a player, what force, four runs
shortish again, Gayle shuffles across the stumps and tries to manufacture a cheeky dab past backward point, doesnt time it well though
slower ball, fuller outside off stump and moving in, Gayle covers his stumps and shoulders arms
good length ball on off stump, Bravo hops and defends to mid-off
similar ball, Bravo goes back and punches to mid-off again&

fuller, Bravo drops the hands and squeezes that to point, calls for the run and there's hesitation on his part, but Gayle's lumbering down the pitch and Bravo carries on with the run, a bad throw lets him off

what a ball! Full and fast, moves in and Gayle goes defending, ball beats him for pace and knocks back off stump, the ball swung just enought to beat the outside of the bat, and Bracken has done all the damage this afternoon
full, seaming delivery outside off stump, Lara shuffles across the stumps and shoulders arms
full outside off stump, Lara gets a large stride forward and defends
good ball, pitches outside off stump, Bravo behind it and defends
good ball outside off stump, Bravo goes back and defends again
a fraction wider and Bravo unleashes the extravagant cut shot, misses by a fair distance
lands outside off stump, Bravo again right behind it and defends back to McGrath
full outside off stump, he shoulders arms
pitches on off stump, Bravo defends, ball rolls to midwicket
full and seaming outside off stump, Lara goes after the slower ball but mistimes the drive, gets an inside edge
lands outside off stump and moves away, suckering Lara into the front foot defense and beating him all ends up
a good length outside off stump, Lara gets on top of it and turns that to midwicket for a quick single, Bravo does well to respond

pitches outside leg stump and raps him on the leg as he goes to flick, Bracken lets out a loud appeal but Aleem Dar isnt interested, some casual running that from Bravo as the ball went wide of square leg
full outside off stump, Lara comes out and defends, ball clips the pad
slower ball outside off stump, defends and manages to keep that along the ground down to third man for one
good ball moving across him from off stump, Lara covers off stump and shoulders arms
another good ball swinging away, Lara gets a stride forward and raises the bat
fuller this time, Lara gets right on top of that with some exagerrated frontfoot defense
quicker ball on the stumps, Lara defends
full and seaming away outside off stump, he shoulders arms
good length again outside off stump, Lara comes forward and squeezes that to backward point
short of a good length outside off stump, Bravo stands and defends to cover
a good length on off stump, Bravo drives back to Lee
short of a good length, Bravo drives off the backfoot to mid-off, not timed well
fast delivery outside off stump and lifting, Bravo shoulders arms
great ball! Full and fast, lands outside off stump, sucks him into an expansive drive, and moves enough to beat his bat, that was close
a good length ball on middle and off, he stands tall and whips that past square leg for four, good shot
full outside off stump, left alone
moving away from outside off stump, Lara comes forward and shoulders arms, rapped on the front leg, a muted appeal from McGrath
fullish and moving away from outside off stump, again Lara shoulders arms with a big stride forward
full outside off stump, Lara drives expansively but straight to cover
good length on off stump, Lara shuffles and works that straight to midwicket

excellent catch! Amazing! Full and moving away outside off stump, Lara comes well forward and defends, but that little bit of deviation was enough to draw the edge and Gilchrist behind the stumps dived to his left and holds onto a fine one-handed catch, that ball was dipping, bye bye Lara
good ball, moves into him from middle and leg, caught on the upper thigh
good ball outside off stump, Bravo drives to cover
good length outside off stump again, played with an angled bat to backward point
similar ball, he hurries into his drive but cant beat the offside circle
full on the stumps, driven down the ground in style, but Bracken moves around quickly from mid-on and saves runs
full outside off stump, Morton gets the foot forward and goes for a booming offside drive, ends up with an inside edge down to McGrath at fine leg, Lee not impressed by Morton's choice of shot
full and Bravo drives to Clarke at mid-off, they set off for a risky single and get it as the throw's off the mark
full on off stump, whipped to Ponting at midwicket who fires in a throw at the nonstrikers end, but all safe in the end
full outside off stump, squeezed to backward point
short of a good length outside off stump, Bravo cracks the backfoot drive to backward point, misfield allows the run
short of a good length ball on off stump, Morton goes back and defends
good ball nips back from outside off stump, Morton stands and tries to defend, ball takes the inside edge and rolls close to the stumps
good length outside off stump, driven to cover off the back foot
lands flat on middle and leg, he goes back and works that past Ponting
tossed up on middle and off, comes forward and defends
tossed up on middle and leg, comes forward and flicks to midwicket
lands outside off and spins in,  Bravo makes room and cuts to cover
short again but he cant beat the man at cover
tossed down quicker and Bravo has to adjust his drive, ends up almost tapping that back to Symonds
lands outside off and raps him on the front leg as he comes forward, a muted appeal from McGrath and Gilchrist
gone! Hits the deck on a great length - typical McGrath - and Morton stands and chases it, a regulation thick edge into Gilchrist's gloves and West Indies slip further
full outside off stump, left alone
good length outside off stump, pushed to cover&
brings this one into him, he defends and almost gets an inside edge
this one's full and moving away, Samuels leaves it alone, fine over from McGrath
tossed up on the stumps, defended
tossed up again, defended
tosses this one in shorter, Bravo makes room and smashes the cut past point for four, good shot
flatter, flicked to Hogg at square leg, who misfields
tossed up, comes forward and defends back to Symonds
tossed up, he dances down the track and hammers that as hard as they come past Symonds' outstretched left hand, shouts of 'CATCH IT' and all, but that balls gone down the ground for four, well struck
poor ball, well wide of leg stump, swings and Gilchrist has work to do
short of a length outside off stump, Bravo drives off the back foot to the offside sweeper in the deep
moves into him from a good length, he defends to the on side
slower ball on middle and leg, he drops the hands and picks up one in front of square leg
short of a good length outside off stump, Bravo drives off the backfoot to a diving Clarke at backward point
fuller outside off stump, he comes forward and defends in front of Clarke this time
changes the pace again, ball tucks him up on middle and leg, he falls over in his defense and the ball rolls to the offside but Watson's on it in a flash
tossed up on middle and leg, flicked around the corner for one
tossed up outside off stump, some spin, Bravo defends and gets an inside edge past leg stump
flighted again, Bravo tries to get cheeky but can only run that to Martyn at gully
the faster one, Bravo comes forward and defends
quicker but theres room outside off stump, and Bravo rocks back and places the cut in the gap between Clarke and Martyn and picks up four, well played
flighted on middle and leg, driven straight to mid-on
drifts to leg stump and its easily worked to deep backward square leg for one
dropped in short, Bravo swivels into the pull but only gets one down to Bracken at a wide fine leg
slower ball on the stumps, Samuels casually defends to cover
gone! Pitched up full on the pads, he goes for the flick, smashed off the middle of the bat but he can only pick out Ponting at mid-on, Samuels continues to disappoint
yorker on the stumps, well dug out
drifts to leg stump and its easily flicked around the corner for four
short and wide, Bravo cuts past cover for one
tossed up on off stump, defended back to Hogg
flatter and spinning in, Baugh goes back and defends back to Hogg
tossed upto the stump, Baugh gets behind it
shorter and offline, spins down leg stump and Baugh helps it along its way, Watson moves around and fields down on the ropes
looped up outside off stump, Baugh comes forward and drives in the gap at cover for one to retain the strike
good length ball comes into him, Baugh manages to defend
short of a good length, Baugh back and across in defense
short and drifting down leg stump, Baugh shuffles and tickles that fine, long leg has some work to do, they pick up another two
short of a length outside off stump, Baugh drives past a diving Symonds at cover and gets two more
slower ball on middle and leg, Baugh almost falls over in his attempt to turn that to leg

gone! Quick and bang on the stumps, Baugh shuffles once too much and tries to play across the line, the ball keeps low and catches him on the hop dead in front, its a simple decision for Koertzen, the end is near for West Indies
Another one goes. And then there were two. Bravo is foxed by a ball coming in and  he shoulders arms. Shock, Surprise..... the ball turns in and he is caught dead in front.
leans forward to smother the spin
And again. He lunges forward in defense
This one went the other away. Taylor fishes at it, reaches out but can't conect. There is a slip in place. I would have a silly point as well
tossed up, lands just outside off, on a length, Taylor lunges forward to play it to the off side. Another successful over comes to an end.
lands on a length, around the off stump line, Bradshaw shuffles a bit, pushes it to the offside

dropped by Gilchrist! A dolly. Bradshaw went for a swipe across the line to a fullish delivery outside off. Got a nick and went straight to Gilly who fluffs it! And the ball heads towards the helmet, 5 penalty runs you would have thought but hold on Ricky Ponting from first slip hurls himself to his right to make the stop!
length-delivery around the off stump, pushed away to the offside
full, straight, coming in with the angle, Bradshaw pushes at it ,gets an inside edge which takes the ball past square-leg
in the air, past the covers. It was full and around the off stump line, Taylor stabs at it and it takes the aerial route, just to right of cover
floated outside off, turns away, Bradshaw leans forward to push it to the off side
slapped to the deep midwicket fence. Short and on the middle and leg, he went back and pulled it
pushed down the legside, quick through the air, wide called
comes down the track, Hogg floats it slower through the air and also holds back the length a bit, Bradshaw adjusts and pushes forward in defense
just outside offstump, turning away, pushed to cover
leans forward to whip a fullish-delivery to long-on.
from round the stumps, banged in short and it rears up towards the ribs, Bradshaw shuffles across, tickles it fine on the legside. Taylor on strike. A bouncer or a will it be a yorker?
Lee goes for the bouncer. Taylor sways away in time. Well bowled and well played.

almost spooned a catch to Hussey at short cover. Lee pinged the full length, Taylor, a bit late in coming forward, pushes at it on the up and it goes in the air,  and Hussey moves to his right and stretches his right hand out but it evades him. Hmmm....
Lee goes for the throat again. Bradshaw, who didn't shuffle across this time, saw it early and just ducked under

Splat....What a calpyso collapso. 139.2kmph yorker-length delivery, came in with the angle, Bradshaw tried to ping the gap in the cover, the bat-angle opened up and the ball brushed the inner-edge and disturbed the furniture.
lands on the middle, turns in, punched back down the track
Ambitious swipe across the line, down to long-on. It was tossed up, just outside the offstump and turned in.
full, comes in, Collymore is struck at his crease, pushes his bat, way ahead of his body, keeps it out
The googly. Darts sharply the other way and Collymore, clueless, ends up pushing inside the line
almost a yorker-length delivery, on the middle, dug out in a hurry
Aha! this one spins back in sharply from outside off, Collymore had done a Bravo, shouldered arms but was struck outside the line and more importantly the ball was not going on to hit the sticks
full, fast and attempted yorker turns into low full-toss, driven to long-on. But they don't take the single.
Lee doesn't like the fact that Taylor thinks he can handle him, pings in a bouncer, Taylor does well to sway away.
spears this one fullish in length, outside the offstump, pushed away to deep cover and Taylor decides to jog across. Collymore on strike.

And the West Indian innings ends in confusion. A run out. Collymore pushes a length-delivery to the on side, sets off for a run, Taylor doesn't concur with the idea. Meanwhile Symonds runs to his right from short midwicket, swoops on the ball, flicks a throw and its a fatal hit.

inn2.comm: floats it on the middle and leg, Gilchrist gets off the mark with a push to wide mid-on
on the off, goes on straight after landing, Watson goes back to push it back down the track
And again.
on the middle and leg, Watson goes back to whip it past square-leg, Marlon Samuels, running in from long-leg, fumbles and they get an extra run
on the middle and leg, Watson punches it past midwicket
on the off and middle, keep a touch low after landing on a length, Watson, again, goes back to dead-bat it away.
length-delivery, angled across, Gilchrist stands tall, punches it on the up, to mid-off. no chance of a run.
back-of-length delivery, around the offstump line,slanted away, pushed to cover point

139.3 kmph delivery that hastened after pitching short of length. Gilchrist shapes to pull but is beaten for pace and it runs off the thigh to the offside. Watson spots a chance for a sinlge and rushes across.
In the zone outside the offstump, Watson covers the stumps and lets that one go through to the 'keeper
Well picked up by Watson. Full and on the legs, Watson flicked it over square-leg. Good piece of timing, the ball just flew flat and fast.
length-delivery, just outside the offstump and Gilchrist tries to force it off the back foot, the bat comes down in a angle and he gets an inside edge on to his pads
pitches it further up, just outside the offstump, Gilchrist brings his bat down and takes it ahead of his body, makes contact and the ball rolls to mid-off
Again full in length, and on the middle and off, driven to mid-on.  Bradshaw is going to pitch it up, hoping for some swing.
Wrong. hits the deck short of length this time and Gilchrist swivels of his front foot to pull it to deep backward square-leg. Got to pitch it up.
length-delivery, slanting away, Watson dabs it to thirdman.

Got him! Gilchrist falls early. Bradshaw pinged the full length and in the channel outside offstump. Gilchrist ends up driving on-the-up and inside the line and the ball moves just enough to take the outside edge. Flew straight to Gayle at first slip who swallows it. One down, nine to go for West Indies while Australia require another 127 runs
Taylor keeps it  in the zone, Watson watches it sail through to Baugh.
on the offstump line this time, Watson shuffles across to push it to cover point. There is a buzz around the arena.
Crowd roar as Taylor races in. Again on that offstump line, on a length and again Watson goes back and across, presents the full face of the bat in defense
fuller and faster, on the offstump line again, Watson stays back, rather than going forward, pushes it away to the off side. Ponting rushes across for a single
on the offstump line, defended off the front foot

Taylor has nailed Ponting! Game on! Absolutely plumb. Ponting lunges forward  and across to a fullish delivery on the middle stump line and ends up playing around his front pad and is caught dead in front. As Micheal Holding would say, that would have missed the leg and the off, would have taken out the middle.
Slides away after landing around the offstump line, Watson, bit unsure, pushes at it and gets an outside edge to thirdman. Martyn on strike. Crowd are buzzing
Martyn leans forward to a fullish-delivery on the off and middle, and presents the full face of the bat in defense.
Much fuller, an half-volley, outside the offstump, Martyn just pushes it towards mid-off. He is not going to take any risk now
Drags this one on the legside, on the hips, tucked away behind square-leg
full in length, just outside the offstump, came in a touch, left alone
pushes this one down the leg side and Aleem Dar extends his arms to signal wide
just outside the offstump, left alone
well outside the offstump, full in length, goes away a touch, inviting Martyn to go after it but he resists. Allows it to go through to the 'keeper
Attempted yorker goes awry. Slips down the leg side.
Super shot. Minimum fuss. He leans forward to a half-volley outside the offstump and just pushes his bat through the line. It races past extra cover.
length-delivery outside the offstump, holds up after landing and Martyn is bit early into his punch-drive. The ball goes in the air but through the gap between point and cover.
In the zone outside off, Watson covers the stumps and shoulders arms. Watson is being extra cautious today.
right on money first up. just outside the offstump, moves away late in the air, Martyn, such a class act, leans forward , covers the swing and pushes it to the offside
lands on a length, on the offstump line, just shapes away a touch. Again Martyn leans forward, covers for the away movement, brings his bat outside the line and makes contact
in that zone again, pushed to cover.
Martyn rings the room service and Collymore serves with a short one well outside the offstump. Martyn cuts it over backward point.
In an effort to correct the line and the length, he ends up pushing this one full and down the leg side. Wide.
gets it right this time. Lands on a length, just outside the offstump, comes in a touch, defended off the front foot.
On the offstump line again, dead-batted away without any fuss
hurls it across full in length, in the channel outside the offstump, Watson shuffles across, he doesn't quite move back and across and behind the line, pushes it to the offside
slaps a back-of-length delivery through the offside ring. again that shuffle, first the weight goes on to the front foot, then the back leg goes sideways before he stood tall to punch it.
much fuller this time, on the middle, Watson is bit late in getting his bat down, but manages to keep it out
No problem this time, shuffles across before leaning forward, head over the ball, to dead-bat a length-delivery
pings the zone outside off, straightens after landing on a length, Watson pushes his bat, away from his body, steers it to point
On-driven to the midwicket fence. Overpitched mind you and on the legs but still had to be put away. Done with some style.
good ball. Hint of late inswing as the ball speared in towards middlestump line, Martyn gets behind the line perfectly and offers the full face of the bat in defense.
this one goes away after landing. Left alone without any fuss.
comes in with the angle. Full in length. Martyn leans forward, head over the ball and left elbow high and all that jazz. Purrfect forward defense
Yep, this one leaves Martyn, lands outside the offstump and just shapes away, left alone.
Lands on the middle, comes in with the angle, worked around to midwicket

short of length, outside the offstump, Martyn cuts but Runako Morton, at point, hurls himself to his right to make a half-stop. The ball bounds off to his right, there is almost a mix-up as the batsmen think about a run before deciding against it
on the offstump line, defended off the front foot
pushes it on to the pads and Watson whips it past midwicket
in-dipper. Pitched on the middle and came in, tucked past square-leg
speared in full and on the legs, tickled around the corner
Fab shot. Overpitched outside the offstump, out comes the bat ahead of his pads, just a mere push and the ball races to the point fence. What a wonderful piece of timing.
Supper break is on. A fullish delivery on the middle, defended off the front foot.
Starts off the post-break play with an attempted yorker. Turns into a low full-toss, driven to mid-on
just outside the offstump, full in length, Watson leans forward to push it close on the offside.
Slower off break. Lands on the offstump line and spins away, cut straight to point.
in the zone outside off, full in length, Watson leans forward to push it towards cover. Andrew Symonds and Michael Clarke are both padded up in the dressing room.
outside the offstump, slanting away further, Watson cuts but doesn't time it well, the bat comes down in an angle, gets an outside edge which takes the ball towards thirdman.
short of length, just outside the offstump, dabbed to thirdman. Martyn will be on strike now.
full and in the channel outside the offstump, pushed away to cover
again in that zone, bit more width this time, run down to thirdman
Collymore pings the corridor again, Watson thrusts his left foot out, covers the stumps before shouldering his arms
Ah! Some seam-movement on display. This one landed on a length, outside the offstump, and jagged back in to beat the defensive prod and rapped Watson on his inner thigh.
overpitched outside the offstump, square-driven straight to point
on the legs, tucked to backward square
short and Watson pulls it past midwicket. He has fallen a few times playing that shot but this one was really short in length
hit off the back foot, past cover
in the zone outside the offstump, Martyn leans forward to present the full face of the bat in defense
on the middle and leg, tucked past square-leg. Lovely roll of the wrists and away she goes
Watson gets a single albeit that was not his intention. Just short of length delivery, outside the offstump, Watson is bit late in taking his bat out of the line, ends up tapping it down to thirdman
Collymore pings the legs, flicked away without fuss to the left of deep midwicket. Martyn was shouting "Two" even as he played that stroke and gets that two.
Corrects his line and pushes this one in the corridor, left alone
bit of room outside off, back of length too but Martyn cuts it straight to point.
almost lemon-cut back on the stumps. Bradshaw had slanted it across Watson who went back to force it past point but got an inside-edge.
On the middle and leg, full in length, Martyn tries to flick it away, gets an inside edge on to the pads that takes the ball to short thirdman
On the middle and off, again one of those slanting away, Watson leans forward to dead-bat it away.
slightly short of length, just outside the offstump line, Watson stands up tall to punch it to mid-off&
on the middle, Watson works his wrists over time to tap the ball into the gap at midwicket. Easy single. Australia continue to milk runs.
No milking this time as Martyn pushes a length-delivery straight to mid-off.
bang on the offstump line, Watson shuffles across a touch, pats it close on the on side, looks up at Martyn who responds and away they cross over for a single. Easy as it gets.
short of length and outside the offstump, comes slowly off the track and that disrupts Martyn's square-drive. Ends up pushing it towards point.
ooh... no stopping Martyn this time. In the slot, on the middle and leg, and he caresses it through the midwicket. Super timing.
tip and run. Just pushes a length-delivery on the offstump line, towards cover point and runs with the stroke
spears in full, outside the offstump, Watson drives but gets an inside-edge that takes the ball to deep backward square-leg
just short of driveable length, around the offstump line, pushed back down the track.
On the off and middle stump line, slightly short of length, whipped past square-leg and they come back for two, beating Chanderpaul's throw
fuller and on the off and middle, Watson eases forward to place it to right of mid-on
This is all getting rather easy. Another short of length delivery, punched past cover.
beaten outside off. It was full and slanted away, Watson initially shaped up to leave it but had a change of mind and poked at it.
Partly-steered, partly-edged to thirdman fence. Again slanted away and full in length, Watson opened the bat-face.
Can't prevent another tip and run effort though. Just pushed short of point and they rush across for a quick single.
length-delivery on the off and middle, pushed towards mid-on.
Brilliant fielding by Samuels. Watson had punched off the back foot and had almost pinged the gap to left of Samuels at mid-on but he hurled himself to the left to make the stop
Taylor gift-wraps a boundary, Martyn accepts it. Full and on the legs, flicked away gracefully.
lands short of length, just outside the offstump and comes in a touch, Martyn stands up tall, waits for the ball to arrive before punching it on the up to mid-off.
on the middle, turned to square-leg
turns in from the middle stump line, worked with the spin, past square-leg.
floats it outside off, defended off the front foot
on the middle, turns in, tickled to square-leg
on the middle again, driven to mid-on
leans forward to smother the spin. Not that there is much of it.
drifting on the legs, attempted flick, clips the pads enroute to Baugh
back-of-length delivery, around the offstump line, punched back down the track
length-delivery, just outside the offstump, and Watson pings the deep point with a cracking square-drive on a bent knee.
And almost a repeat. Slightly shorter in length, and he goes back and across to punch it past point.
super shot. Taylor attempts an yorker, ends up serving it full on the legs, Watson gets his front foot out of the line, doesn't lunge across like Ponting did, and drives it past mid-on.
Taylor ends his spell - only 7 overs, this is a 35-overs game now - with a bouncer. Easily ducked under.
full, on the middle, driven to wide mid-on
leans forward, uses his wrist to turn a fullish-delivery past square-leg
eases forward to ping the long-on fielder. As easy as it gets.
turns in from off stump, worked to square-leg
turns in from outside off, defended off the front foot
slightly shorter this time, allows Martyn to sit on the back foot and bring his wrists into play. Sends it through the midwicket gap. Another single.
full and straight, defended off the front foot
West Indies continue to leak singles. Martyn leans forward and square-drives a fullish-delivery past cover.
back-of-length delivery, in the channel outside the offstump, Watson shuffles across to push it towards point.
On a driveable length, around that offstump line, Watson leans forward and eases it to mid-off.
And again.
low full-toss, so we have to wait for another ball to see some spin, driven to long-on
Hmm... another full-toss, atleast this one dipped but the line was wrong. on the legs and placed through the gap at midwicket
from round the stumps, lands outside leg, turns in a bit, defended off the front foot
outside the leg stump, tickled around the corner
again outside the legstump, looking for the rough there, worked to square-leg&
the third full-toss of the over, not put away though. Driven straight to mid-on
floats it on the middle, worked past midwicket.
spins in from outside off, defended off the front foot.
attempted sweep, runs off the pads to fine-leg
on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket.
Another single tickles in as Martyn pushes a fullish delivery to right of midwicket
turns from outside the leg stump, worked to square-leg
Watson stirs, opens the stance and whacks a shortish-delivery but straight to deep midwicket. Crowd roar their approval.
comes down the track, drives to mid-on. Will Watson go for the jugular next over? Cmon big fella, throw your bat around!
leans forward to smother the spin. Doesn't put bat to ball but takes it on his pads.
turns in from outside off, Martyn walks across, lets the ball to spin to his hips, tickles it to short fine-leg
Aha! big turn has Watson in some tangle. He shapes to cut a delivery that landed well outside the offstump but is surprised by the spin and is rapped on the thighpad
fifty up for Watson. He had not scored many in this tournament and this should please his mother. Driven to long-off
But Australia are intent on getting there in singles and twos. Comes down the track, takes it on the full but no violence. Just pushes it past extra cover
wide down the legside, attempted sweep but doesn't connect. Good work from the wicketkeeper Baugh who gathers it smartly and whips off the bails.
comes down the track and drives it powerfully to cover region
short and well outside the offstump, Martyn hurries across to cut but can't make proper contact.
full and well outside the offstump, left alone
Again well outside the offstump, lost control there and this time declared a wide.
Short and outside off, Martyn cuts it fine, Samuels misfields it at backward point to keep the crowd humoured
wide outside the offstump, full in length, square-driven past point. Chanderpaul tries to finish things off quickly with a misfield!
turns in on the middle and leg line, whipped past square-leg
Martyn wants to end up unbeaten. Who can grudge him that. Defends off the front foot.
And again.
That's it!  Watson brings up the Australian win with a tickle behind square-leg.  Australia have won the Champions Trophy for the first time.
